title: PHPxorKeyword

metadata.description: Learn about PHPxorKeyword with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content: Example Output a message only if just one of the expressions is true: Definition and Usage The xor keyword is a logical operator. Logical operators are used to combine conditional statements. The return value will only be true if one of the statements is true and the other one is false . Note: This operator has lower precedence than the assignment operator, which may lead to confusing results. Wrap the expression in parentheses to avoid unexpected results. Related Pages Read more about operators in our PHP Operators Tutorial . More Examples Example Show the difference in precedence: "; $result2 = (true xor true); echo "(true xor true) = "; echo $result2 ? "true" : "false"; ?> ★ +1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
<?php
if(5 < 3 xor 5 < 10) {
echo "Only one of the expressions 
  was true";
}
?>

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code: "; $result2 = (true xor true); echo "(true xor true) = "; echo $result2 ? "true" : "false"; ?>

summary: This tutorial covers PHPxorKeyword concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPxorKeyword effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPxorKeyword and how to apply it in your projects.
